ngiemboon: Azẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a la pú ńjÿó Yěsô, ńgÿo á fó nkʉ̀ŋ ntse Juundʉŋ ńgʉa né kwòŋotsẅɛ,
en: Then Jesus   left the Jordan,  # 4:1 Lk 3:3 full of the Holy Spirit,  # 4:1 Lk 1:15,41,67; Ac 2:4; 4:8,31; 9:17; 11:24; 13:9 and was led by the Spirit  # 4:1 Gl 5:18 in the wilderness

ngiemboon: ńtsẅé wó lyɛ̌ʼ láʼ móm lekùɔ, Sátà ne ńgwá ńtóo ńkwaʼte yé kwaʼte. Yěsô gÿo ńnéŋe wó, ńdáʼ te mmó pfɛ́ tà á cʉ́ʼ nzsòzsò, nzyè gyáŋa yé.
en: for forty days   to be tempted by the devil. He ate nothing during those days, and when they were over, he was hungry.

ngiemboon: Sátà leen ńtó ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: «Páʼ ɔɔ Míŋ Ssé la, leen ńké ńtsẅi né tóon wɛ̂ ngie à sele ńcʉ́ʼʉ mmó léjÿó ɔ̀ jÿó.»
en: The devil said to him, “If you are the Son of God, tell this stone to become bread.”

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́ʼɔ mbwó yé ngie: «Mé la ŋweʼe tsɛ̀ɛ Ŋwàʼne Ssé ngie “nyìŋ te lɔg pɔ́ ndàʼ mmó gie à pfɛ́ tá ńgwɔ́ wó wɔ́.”»
en: But Jesus answered him, “It is written: Man must not live on bread alone.”   ,# 4:4 Dt 8:3,# 4:4 Dt 8:3

ngiemboon: Sátà leen ńké ńkwéʼe yé ńtÿɔ́gɔ tsɔ́ jʉʼ tàa tÿǒ, ńtyé wó ńgÿo á pú ńgyá mengwòŋo mengwòŋ mie ée tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó tàʼ legʉ̀a,
en: So he took him up   and showed him all the kingdoms of the world  # 4:5 Is 23:17; Jr 25:26 in a moment of time.

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: «Mé léen ḿbú ńná mengwòŋ mɛ̂ né mèŋ, m biŋ ńkuʼu lépú ńná né wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ gẅie n kwǒŋ. N ge zɔɔn ná lefùɔ né gù, gù zɔ cʉ́ʼʉ ńdɔgɔ ńgẅiin shúm mbòŋo sie ée tsoló ntsèm.
en: The devil said to him, “I will give you their splendor and all this authority, because it has been given over to me,   and I can give it to anyone I want.

ngiemboon: N gɔɔn pɔ́ ndàʼ ngie ɔ̀ ŋwɔ́ʼ nnɛ́ mvfò mèŋ, ńguʼte wɔ́ɔn, e leen ńcʉ́ʼ shú.»
en: If you, then, will worship me,   all will be yours.”

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́ʼɔ mbwó yé ngie: «Mé la ŋweʼe tsɛ̀ɛ Ŋwàʼne Ssé ngie: “Nyìŋ ŋwɔ́ʼ nnɛ́ tà zi ye kíbe ssé pɔ́ ndàʼ mvfò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Ssé gíle yé, ḿbiŋ ńjúʼ pɔ́ ndàʼ ncwò wé.”»
en: And Jesus answered him,   “It is written: Worship the Lord your God, and serve   # 4:8 Dt 6:13 him only.”   # 4:8 Dt 6:13

ngiemboon: Sátà leen ńdɔgɔ Yěsô ńgʉa né Yelúzálèm, ńtÿɔ́gɔ yé na ntsɔ̀ʼ gie ee na ndá Ssé, ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: «Páʼ ɔɔ Míŋ Ssé la, fó jʉʼɔɔn, ńkyɛ́, ńtyé ssé, mélàʼmie
en: So he took him to Jerusalem, had him stand on the pinnacle of the temple, and said to him, “If you are the Son of God, throw yourself down from here.

ngiemboon: mé la ŋweʼe tsɛ̀ɛ Ŋwàʼne Ssé ngie: “E Ssé ge tsẅi mecÿɔ́ʼ pé tó ḿbyɛ́bte gú.
en: For it is written:

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ ge lɔg mbwó mɔ́b, é kaa gú tà ɔ́ le túu kwò jú na tóon wɔ́.”»
en: and

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́ʼɔ mbwó yé ngie: «Mé la gíŋ ŋweʼe tsɛ̀ɛ Ŋwàʼne Ssé ngie: “Pɔ́ɔn léláʼ ńkwaʼte Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Ssé jù.”»
en: And Jesus answered him, “It is said: Do not test the Lord your God.”   ,# 4:12 Dt 6:16

ngiemboon: Sátà kwaʼte Yěsô tà ḿmag mentí, ńgyá kékáŋ, ńnyé yé, ńgʉa, ńne ńzẅíʼte fʉ̀ʼ yendyɛ̀ʼɛ gie à ge gÿo gíŋ tóo na yé.
en: After the devil had finished every temptation, he departed from him for a time.

ngiemboon: Yěsô leen ńké ńgwaa gíŋ piŋ né Ngalílîa, à Zẅìge Ssé ne ńnáa yé metʉ̀, á lɔgɔ ńnyɛɛ mefàʼ Ssé. Lezíŋ sé pú saa yɛ̌ pàga ngwòŋ ŋwɛ́,
en: Then Jesus returned to Galilee in the power of the Spirit,   and news about him spread throughout the entire vicinity.  # 4:14 Mt 4:24; 9:26,31; Mk 1:28,45; Lk 4:37; 5:15; 9:60

ngiemboon: mélàʼmie à la ne ńdaʼte nò Ssé á ndá cúʼtè pà Yúndà, pʉ̀a metsèm ne ńguʼte yé.
en: He was teaching in their synagogues,   being praised  # 4:15 Or glorified by everyone.

ngiemboon: Yěsô láʼ ńnéŋe tà ḿbiŋe Nǎzalɛd, á jʉʼ gie à la gúʼu wó. Alyɛʼɛ́ nzse yɔ́b kuʼ. Á gʉa ndá cúʼtè pà Yúndà páʼ aa ńzɔɔn ńgee. Afʉ̀ʼ kuʼ, á lu ssé létóŋo Ŋwàʼne Ssé.
en: He came to Nazareth, where he had been brought up.   As usual, he entered the synagogue on the Sabbath day  # 4:16 Mt 13:54; Mk 6:1–2 and stood up to read.  # 4:16 Ac 13:14–16

ngiemboon: Mé pí lekaʼá ŋwàʼne Esáyà ntsẅìnkʉ̀ Ssé, ńná né yé. Á nyɛ́ʼɛ na jʉʼ gie mé la ŋweʼe wó ngie:
en: The scroll of the prophet Isaiah was given to him, and unrolling the scroll, he found the place where it was written:

ngiemboon: «Azẅìge Cʉ̀apʉ̀a áa na mèŋ, mélàʼmie à la zɔ́ʼɔ wɔ́ɔn,
en: The Spirit of the Lord is on me,

ngiemboon: ńgíŋ, ńtúmo wɔ́ɔn ngie n gʉa ésáʼa mbwó láʼ ngie
en: to proclaim the year of the Lord’s favor.    ,# 4:18–19 Is 61:1–2; Mt 11:5; 12:18; Jn 3:34

ngiemboon: Yěsô la tóŋo yɛ̌ jʉʼ tà ḿmag, ńkábte ŋwàʼne, ńnáa mbwó nyìŋ gẅie à faʼa ndá ŋwɛ́, ésẅɛ́ʼ, ńnéŋe ssé lékyagte. Epʉ̀a pie é laa ndá cúʼtè pú ńtÿɔ́g menÿɔ́g na yé, ńne ńzẅíʼte.
en: He then rolled up the scroll, gave it back to the attendant, and sat down.   And the eyes of everyone in the synagogue were fixed on him.

ngiemboon: Á leen ńké ńzye lékyagte, ńgɔɔn ngie: «Menò mie pi fóo léjúʼu tsɛ̀ɛ Ŋwàʼne Ssé lɛ̂, é pumté lyɛ̌ʼɔɔn.»
en: He began by saying to them, “Today as you listen, this Scripture has been fulfilled.”

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ júʼu shwóŋè gie á kẅɛɛ ncwò yé, á gwaa poŋo wɔ́b, ńgíŋe ńne ńkʉʼʉ wɔ́b, pɔ́ zye lézẅɛ́te, ńgɔɔn ngie: «À te míŋ Yesyɛ̂b wɔ́ le?»
en: They were all speaking well of him   and were amazed by the gracious words that came from his mouth; yet they said, “Isn’t this Joseph’s son? ”  # 4:22 Mt 13:55; Mk 6:3; Jn 6:42

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́ʼɔ mbwó pɔ́b ngie: «Pi ge gÿo pɛ́ʼɛ̀ tà sag né mèŋ ngie: “Angÿò meffo zoŋo twó mbùm yé, ngie ammó gie n ka gÿo Kapɛ́ɛnàwum, n gíŋe ńgÿo jʉʼɔɔn, á láʼ peg, tá pi zẅíŋe wɔ́ɔn.”»
en: Then he said to them, “No doubt you will quote this proverb    to me: ‘Doctor, heal yourself. What we’ve heard that took place in Capernaum,   # 4:23 Mt 11:23; Mk 2:1–12; Jn 4:46–53 do here in your hometown also.’ ”

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋ ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: «Tà mèŋ n ké shwóŋo gẅí nénʉ́, mé ee ntěen ńzẅíŋe nò ntsẅìnkʉ̀ Ssé láʼ pɔ́b wɔ́.
en: He also said, “Truly I tell you, no prophet is accepted in his hometown.

ngiemboon: Tà mèŋ shwóŋo gẅí, kwàʼ nénʉ́, á laa fʉ̀ʼ ye Elîɛ, ntsẅìnkʉ̀ Ssé, mepfɔ̌g panzwě gwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ pà Ésàlayɛ tɛʼ. Mbʉ̀ŋ láʼ ńnéŋe ngùʼ tá né mesaŋ ntɔgɔ́ té lú, tà máamáa gwáŋa gwe tsɛ̀ɛ láʼa pa Ésàlayɛ ntsèm.
en: But I say to you, there were certainly many widows in Israel in Elijah’s days,    when the sky was shut up for three years and six months while a great famine came over all the land.

ngiemboon: Táʼ, e Ssé ké ńdáʼ te túmo Elîɛ mbʉ̀a tsɔ́ wɔb wɔ́, ńtsẅi, á kẅɛ ńgʉa pɔ́ né ndá tsɔ̌ mpfɔ̌g manzwě gẅie à laa Salɛ́btà, á tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ Sindoŋ.
en: Yet Elijah was not sent to any of them except a widow at Zarephath in Sidon.

ngiemboon: Á láʼ ńgwɔ́ na fʉ̀ʼ ye ntsẅìnkʉ̀ Ssé Elize, megàŋnkàʼ pǎb gwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ pa Ésàlayɛ tà ńgyɔ́ɔn, Elize la ké te gÿo tsɔ̌ tàʼ na pɔ́b zéŋe wɔ́, tà ńdíndàʼ Naamaŋ nyìŋ Sili.»
en: And in the prophet Elisha’s time, there were many in Israel who had leprosy,    and yet not one of them was cleansed except Naaman the Syrian.”   # 4:27 2Kg 5:1–14

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a metsèm pie é laa ndá cúʼtè júʼ púʼu, lóŋ wɔb ffó.
en: When they heard this, everyone in the synagogue was enraged.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ pú ńdu ssé metsèm, ńgwoon Yěsô ńdɔgɔ yé fó tÿǒsoŋ, ńkẅɛ tà ńkúu na twó lekwɔʼɔ́, á jʉʼ gie mé la kwɛɛ tÿǒsoŋ yɔ́b wó, ńne faʼa létsó yé ḿmaʼa tsɛ̀ɛ kòon.
en: They got up, drove him out of town,   and brought him to the edge of the hill that their town was built on, intending to hurl him over the cliff.

ngiemboon: Táʼ, Yěsô tɔ́gɔ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b, ńgʉa.
en: But he passed right through the crowd and went on his way.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gÿo púʼu, ńcwóŋ ńgʉa né Kapɛ́ɛnàwum, á gwɔ́ tsɔ́ tÿǒsoŋ na pàga ngwòŋ Ngalílîa. Alyɛʼɛ́ ńzsé yɔ́b kúʼ, á ne ńzíʼi pʉ̀a nò Ssé.
en: Then he went down to Capernaum,   a town in Galilee, and was teaching them on the Sabbath.

ngiemboon: Mé pú ḿmɔɔn ye ntí leziʼí pʉ̀a mmó, mélàʼmie e Ssé la ne ńnáa yé metʉ̀ tá á lɔgɔ ńgɔɔn nò.
en: They were astonished at his teaching because his message had authority.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ nyìŋ gwɔ́ yé ndá cúʼtè ŋwɛ́, etsɔ̌ ssé tepòŋ gwɔ́ na yé, ńnéŋe tà ńtsóte yé, á lɔg ngyè tetʉ̂ ne ńgaʼte ńgɔɔn ngie:
en: In the synagogue there was a man with an unclean demonic spirit who cried out with a loud voice,

ngiemboon: «Yěsô nyìŋ Nǎzalɛd, pege gẅiin kɔ́? Ɔ̀ ka fɔ̌ɔn ńtó pɔ́ lépyága wég ka? N ne ńzsé gú, ɔ̀ fóo lejʉ́ŋ Ssé, ńgwɔ́ míŋ we.»
en: “Leave us alone! What do you have to do with us, Jesus of Nazareth? Have you come to destroy us? I know who you are #— #the Holy One of God! ”

ngiemboon: Yěsô cÿɔ́g yɛ̌ ssé tepòŋ, ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: «Láŋte, éfó na nyìŋ wɛ̂ ńkẅɛ.» E ssé tepòŋ ŋwɛ́ tsẅíʼi yé ńtéme ssé á mvfò pʉ̀a, ńdeen ńké fó na yé ńkẅɛ té gÿo mmó na yé.
en: But Jesus rebuked him   and said, “Be silent and come out of him! ”   # 4:35 Mk 1:25; 9:25 And throwing him down before them, the demon came out of him without hurting him at all.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a metsèm la gyá púʼu, ḿbú ńcÿɔʼ, ésele ńzɛ́te tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b ngie: «Ashwóŋè ndÿò wɔɔn áa páʼɔɔn ńgwɔ́ lêkɔ́ lɛ̂? À tʉ tʉ tà ńtsẅii nò mbwó messé tepòŋ pɔ́ fóo na nyìŋ ńkẅɛɛ!»
en: Amazement came over them all, and they were saying to one another, “What is this message? For he commands the unclean spirits with authority and power, and they come out! ”

ngiemboon: Lezíŋ Yěsô leen ḿbú saa yɛ̌ pàga ngwòŋ.
en: And news about him began to go out to every place in the vicinity.

ngiemboon: Yěsô kẅɛɛ ndá cúʼtè, ńgee mbʉ̀a Símò, ńgwaa kúu wó, mbà tsɔ̌ ntʉ̀ nnɛ́ kà gwoon mákẅìʼ Símò. Mé sẅíŋte Yěsô ngie à kẅéte yé.
en: After he left the synagogue, he entered Simon’s house.   Simon’s mother-in-law was suffering from a high fever, and they asked him about her.  # 4:38 1Co 9:5

ngiemboon: Á tó ńŋwéʼe ngʉ̀ŋe kǔ, ńdɔg tʉ̀ ńgɔɔn nò, ennɛ́ júʼ ńzáʼa. Mákẅìʼ Símò ŋwɛ́ gwóon ńdu ssé, ńnyɛte shúm ńdɔg ńdye wɔ́b.
en: So he stood over her and rebuked the fever, and it left her. She got up immediately   and began to serve them.

ngiemboon: Nzěm la gwaa síŋ, epʉ̀a lɔg megàŋa guɔ ntí ntí pie é laa mendá pɔ́b, ńtó. Yěsô zába mbwó na wɛ̌wɛ̌ nguɔ wɔ́ɔ, á sẅéte.
en: When the sun was setting, all those who had anyone sick with various diseases brought them to him. As he laid his hands on each one of them, he healed them.

ngiemboon: Messé tepòŋ ne ńgwaa fóo na lelÿò é kẅɛɛ, ńgaʼte ńgɔɔn ngie: «Ɔɔ Míŋ Ssé.» Táʼ, Yěsô cÿɔ́gɔ wɔ́b, à te zẅíŋ ngie pɔ́ gɔɔn nò wɔ́, mélàʼmie pɔ́ la ne ńzsé ngie aa Nzàʼnkÿo pùʼ.
en: Also, demons were coming out of many, shouting and saying, “You are the Son of God! ”   But he rebuked them and would not allow them to speak, because they knew he was the Messiah.  # 4:41 Mt 8:16; Mk 1:34; 3:11–12

ngiemboon: Njÿó gÿo ńdʉ́a, Yěsô fó tÿǒsoŋ ńkẅɛ, ńne ńdɔgɔ ye kwòŋotsẅɛ ńgee, aláʼ kẅɛ ńzye lémwoon jʉʼ faʼa yé, ńgyá yé, éfaʼa lékúʼte yé ngie tà á nyé wɔ́b, ńgʉa.
en: When it was day, he went out and made his way to a deserted place.   But the crowds were searching for him. They came to him and tried to keep him from leaving them.

ngiemboon: Táʼ, Yěsô gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: «N gẅiin légíŋ ńgʉa na metsɔ́ metÿǒsoŋ, ńtsẅi Nkʉ̀ Mbòŋo nò lefùɔ Ssé gẅie Ssé ka túmo wɔ́ɔn ńtsẅii, ée nkẅɛ̌ ndá wɔ́ɔn.»
en: But he said to them, “It is necessary for me to proclaim the good news about the kingdom of God to the other towns also, because I was sent for this purpose.”

ngiemboon: Ńgɔɔn púʼu, ńzye légiŋe tsɛ̀ɛ mendá cúʼtè pà Yúndà, á tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ Yúndà, ńtsẅii nkʉ̀ mbòŋo.
en: And he was preaching in the synagogues of Judea.  ,# 4:44 Mt 4:23; Mk 1:39
